DataElement.preferredName: Neuroblastoma Histology Shimada Classification System Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the Shimada classification system used to determine the neuroblastoma histology.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Neuroblastoma is a specific type of neuroblastic tumor which is characterized by the presense of neuroblastic cells forming groups or nests separated by delicate stromal septa without prominent Schwannian stroma. (Adapted from WHO.)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A classification system defining a neuroblastoma as having a favorable or unfavorable prognosis, based on histopathologic criteria._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: The non-neoplastic connective tissue of an organ.

Concepts.definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
The non-neoplastic connective tissue of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: The non-neoplastic connective tissue of an organ.

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.
The non-neoplastic connective tissue of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
